thread.title: Watch: Scott Frost says 'We had them where we wanted them'
thread.title_full: Watch: Scott Frost says 'We had them where we wanted them' | OregonLive.com

author: Molly Blue | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Watch: Scott Frost says 'We had them where we wanted them'
text:
EUGENE — On third down, two yards from moving the chains and two minutes left in regulation, Oregon's Royce Freeman was stuffed after gaining half of what the Ducks needed.
Another three-and-out possession for the Ducks, who were clinging to a 31-24 lead.
Washington State responded with a 12-play, 78-yard drive in 1:58 to tie the game, then beat Oregon 45-38 in double overtime on Saturday.
"Obviously, looking back, that's the one play," Oregon offensive coordinator Scott Frost said after the game. "We need to be able to get a first down on third-and-two.
"That was our chance to run out the clock and end the game," he added. "That definitely turned the game."
He said: "We had them where we wanted them with five minutes left in the game and we didn't finish."
Frost talked about play calling and about using two quarterbacks — Jeff Lockie and Taylor Alie — in specific situations.
— Molly Blue
mblue@oregonian.com
@mollyablue
